item.title: 美联储哈克仍预计降息，但认为不确定性很大
item.description: 费城联储主席帕特里克-哈克（Patrick Harker）周四表示，他仍预计美国央行将降息，但他补充说，政策路径被相当大的经济不确定性所笼罩。【原文：Philadelphia Federal Reserve President Patrick Harker said on Thursday he still expects the U.S. central bank to cut interest rates but added that the policy path is clouded by considerable economic uncertainty.】

item.title: 美联储主席柯林斯表示，现在是耐心、渐进式降息的时候了
item.description: 波士顿联邦储备银行行长苏珊-柯林斯（Susan Collins）周四表示，经济前景的巨大不确定性要求央行谨慎推进未来的降息措施。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of Boston President Susan Collins said Thursday that significant uncertainty over the outlook calls for the central bank moving forward cautiously with future rate cuts.】

item.title: 亿万富翁弗兰克-麦考特的自由计划提议竞购 TikTok 的美国资产
item.description: 企业家、前洛杉矶道奇队老板弗兰克-麦考特（Frank McCourt）的自由计划（Project Liberty）及其 "人民竞标"（The People's Bid）合作伙伴财团周四表示，他们提议向字节跳动正式出价收购 TikTok 的美国资产。【原文：Entrepreneur and former Los Angeles Dodgers owner Frank McCourt's Project Liberty and its consortium of partners in The People's Bid said on Thursday they proposed to make a formal bid to ByteDance to buy TikTok's U.S. assets.】

item.title: 华尔街日报》报道：瑞银接近就瑞士信贷逃税案达成和解
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周四报道，瑞银集团将支付至少数亿美元，以解决瑞士信贷违反早前与美国司法部就美国客户逃税问题达成的协议的问题。【原文：UBS is set to pay a minimum of hundreds of millions of dollars to settle Credit Suisse's violations of an earlier agreement with the U.S. Department of Justice over customers in the U.S. who evaded tax, the Wall Street Journal reported on Thursday.】

item.title: 欧洲股市回升，债券继续承压
item.description: 周四，欧洲股市扭转了早盘的跌势，政府债券继续承压，美元在一年多以来的最高水平附近持稳。【原文：Government bonds remained under pressure on Thursday and the dollar held steady near its highest levels in more than a year as European stocks reversed early losses.】

item.title: 2024 年美国招聘公告数量为九年来最低
item.description: 周四的一份报告显示，去年美国雇主发布的招聘公告创下了自2015年以来的最低水平，证实了在此期间就业增长的急剧放缓。【原文：Hiring announcements by U.S. employers last year were the lowest since 2015, a report showed on Thursday, confirming a sharp moderation in job growth over that period.】

item.title: 2024 年大众品牌交付量下降 1.4
item.description: 欧洲顶级汽车制造商大众汽车公司周四表示，2024年大众汽车品牌的全球交付量将下降1.4%，降至480万辆，其中电池电动汽车的销量将下降约2.5%。【原文：The Volkswagen brand's global deliveries fell 1.4% to 4.8 million vehicles in 2024, with battery-electric sales down around 2.5%, Europe's top carmaker said on Thursday.】

item.title: Polestar 订单量增加，让人充满希望
item.description: Polestar 周四公布的第四季度零售销售额和订单量均有所增长，这让投资者对这家瑞典电动汽车制造商的高价车型的需求持乐观态度。【原文：Polestar on Thursday reported rises in fourth-quarter retail sales and order intake, raising optimism amongst jittery investors over demand for the Swedish EV maker's higher-priced models.】

item.title: 中国碧桂园提出境外重组交易
item.description: 中国房地产开发商碧桂园（Country Garden）周四表示，该公司提出了一项海外债务重组协议，为债权人提供了多种选择，包括将债务转换为现金和延长到期日。【原文：Chinese property developer Country Garden said on Thursday it proposed a restructuring deal for its offshore debt, providing its creditors multiple options, including converting their debt into cash and maturity extension.】

item.title: 英国消费者信心在圣诞挥霍之后出现动摇
item.description: 英国马莎百货公司（Marks & Spencer）和其他零售商的股票周四下跌，整个行业损失了 20 亿英镑（24.5 亿美元），原因是对消费者信心消退和经济疲软的担忧给健康的圣诞交易蒙上了阴影。【原文：Shares in Britain's Marks & Spencer and other retailers fell on Thursday, with 2 billion pounds ($2.45 billion) wiped off the sector, as concern about ebbing consumer confidence and economic weakness overshadowed healthy Christmas trading.】

item.title: 意大利的梅洛尼说她没有与马斯克讨论过 "星链 "交易
item.description: 意大利总理乔治亚-梅洛尼（Giorgia Meloni）周四表示，她从未与埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）讨论过利用其 "星链"（Starlink）为军方提供安全通信的潜在交易。【原文：Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni said on Thursday she had never discussed with Elon Musk a potential deal to use his Starlink to supply secure communications for the military.】

item.title: 沙特阿美石油公司和索纳特拉奇石油公司下调一月份液化石油气价格
item.description: 石油生产商沙特阿美公司（Saudi Aramco）和阿尔及利亚索纳特拉奇公司（Sonatrach）的贸易商周四表示，由于对液化石油气（LPG）的需求疲软，1月份的液化石油气官方售价（OSP）比12月份下调了1.6%至6%。【原文：Oil producer Saudi Aramco and Algeria's Sonatrach lowered January's official selling prices (OSPs) for liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) by between 1.6% and 6% from December because of weaker demand for the fuel, traders said on Thursday.】

item.title: 慕尼黑再保险公司：气候变化 "张牙舞爪"，灾害成本上升
item.description: 慕尼黑再保险公司（Munich Re）周四表示，2024 年飓风、风暴、洪水和其他自然灾害造成的保险损失估计达 1400 亿美元，高于 2023 年，是有记录以来损失最惨重的年份之一。【原文：Hurricanes, storms, floods and other natural disasters caused an estimated $140 billion in insured losses in 2024, up from 2023 and one of the costliest years on record, Munich Re said on Thursday.】

item.title: 中国 12 月汽车销量增幅扩大
item.description: 中国乘用车联席会（CPCA）周四公布的数据显示，12月份中国汽车销量同比增长12.2%，为连续第四个月增长。【原文：China's car sales in December rose 12.2% from a year earlier, the fourth consecutive monthly gain, data from the China Passenger Car Association (CPCA) showed on Thursday.】

item.title: 空客首席执行官认为特朗普执政期间美国保护主义抬头
item.description: 飞机制造商空中客车公司（Airbus）负责人周四表示，欧洲航空航天公司正在为美国当选总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）即将上任的政府 "非常强烈的 "保护主义做好准备。【原文：European aerospace companies are bracing for "very strong" protectionism in the United States under the incoming administration of President-elect Donald Trump, the head of planemaker Airbus said on Thursday.】

item.title: 美国利率和特朗普关税威胁仍是焦点，亚洲外汇市场看跌坚挺
item.description: 路透社周四的一项民意调查显示，对大多数亚洲货币的看跌押注攀升至数月高点，原因是美国今年降息次数减少的前景继续提振美元需求，而美国可能加征关税的威胁削弱了亚洲高风险资产的吸引力。【原文：Bearish bets on most Asian currencies climbed to multi-month highs as prospects of fewer U.S. interest rate cuts this year continued to boost dollar demand, while the threat of potential U.S. tariffs undermined the appeal of risky Asian assets, a Reuters poll showed on Thursday.】

item.title: Boaz Weinstein 的 Saba 向英国投资信托股东提供全额现金退出方案
item.description: 美国对冲基金萨巴资本管理公司（Saba Capital Management）周四表示，该公司将向英国先驱投资信托公司（Herald Investment Trust）的股东提供全额现金退出，退出价格为其资产净值的 99%，以争取股东批准对董事会进行彻底改革。【原文：U.S. hedge fund Saba Capital Management said on Thursday it would offer shareholders of UK's Herald Investment Trust a full cash exit at 99% of their net asset value, in a bid to win over the shareholders' approval for a board overhaul.】

item.title: 日本 Seven & i 控股公司第三季度利润同比下降 24
item.description: 日本 7-Eleven 连锁便利店运营商 Seven & i 控股公司周四公布的季度营业利润下降了 24%，低于分析师的预期。【原文：Japan's Seven & i Holdings , operator of the 7-Eleven convenience store chain, reported on Thursday a drop of 24% in quarterly operating profit, missing analysts' estimates.】

item.title: 上海启动允许外资医院进入的计划
item.description: 上海已启动一项计划，允许在外籍人士聚居的重点经济区、生物医药区和市中心区设立外商独资医院。【原文：Shanghai has kicked off a plan to allow the establishment in China of wholly foreign-owned hospitals in key economic zones, biopharmaceutical areas and downtown districts that are home to many expatriate residents.】

item.title: 英国石油公司（BP）预计印度最大油田的石油产量将增加 44%，印度国家石油公司（ONGC）称
item.description: 据区块运营商石油和天然气公司周四称，根据一份长达十年的合同，全球能源巨头英国石油公司（BP）承诺将印度西海岸最大油田的石油产量提高 44%，天然气产量提高 89%。【原文：Global energy major BP has pledged to lift oil production by 44% and gas output by 89% from India's largest field off its west coast, under a decade-long contract, according to block operator Oil and Natural Gas Corp on Thursday.】

item.title: 优衣库运营商 Fast Retailing 称第一季度利润增长 7.4
item.description: 全球优衣库服装连锁店的日本运营商周四表示，第一季度营业利润增长了 7.4%，为其连续第四年实现创纪录利润的计划开了个好头。【原文：The Japanese operator of the global Uniqlo clothing chain said on Thursday that first-quarter operating profit rose 7.4%, a solid start to its plan to achieve record profits for a fourth-straight year.】

item.title: 特朗普的关税威胁促使汽车供应商重新考虑生产计划
item.description: 在拉斯维加斯举行的消费电子展（CES）上，业内高管表示，全球汽车供应商正在研究有多少生产可以转移到美国或更靠近美国，以抵御当选总统唐纳德-特朗普承诺的关税。【原文：Global auto suppliers are working out how much of their production can be moved to the United States, or closer to it, as a defense against tariffs promised by President-elect Donald Trump, according to industry executives at CES in Las Vegas.】

item.title: 麦吉尔经纪公司为乌克兰提供财产战争再保险
item.description: 经纪商 McGill and Partners 已为乌克兰推出了一项商业财产战争风险再保险计划，该公司周四表示，这是自 2022 年 2 月俄罗斯入侵乌克兰以来的首个此类计划。【原文：Broker McGill and Partners has launched a commercial property war risk reinsurance programme for Ukraine, which it said on Thursday was the first of its kind since Russia's invasion of the country in Feb 2022.】

item.title: 早间新闻英国处于债券市场风暴中心
item.description: 凯文-巴克兰对欧洲和全球市场未来一天的展望【原文：A look at the day ahead in European and global markets from Kevin Buckland】

item.title: 联合利华在印尼的头疼问题因当地品牌的抵制而加剧
item.description: 联合利华和其他在以色列运营的跨国公司遭到抵制，这加剧了这家全球消费品公司在东南亚最大经济体印度尼西亚市场份额的流失，该公司正在与当地规模较小、价格往往更低的竞争对手展开激烈竞争。【原文：A boycott against Unilever and other multinationals operating in Israel has worsened the global consumer company's loss of market share in Indonesia, Southeast Asia's largest economy, where it is battling smaller, often cheaper local rivals.】

item.title: 外国人转为日本股票净卖家，锁定 2024 年收益
item.description: 截至 1 月 4 日的一周内，外国投资者净卖出日本股票，利用 2024 年的涨势，同时在异常漫长的市场休市期中降低风险。【原文：Foreign investors net sold Japanese stocks in the week ended Jan. 4, taking advantage of 2024 gains while aiming to reduce risks amid an unusually long market closure.】

item.title: 阿波罗地区高层表示将增加日本和亚洲财富的人员配置
item.description: 阿波罗全球管理公司（Apollo Global Management）的地区高管表示，随着全球投资公司向该地区投入更多资源，以抓住交易和资产激增的机遇，该公司计划扩大在日本的业务，并为其亚洲财富业务增加员工。【原文：Apollo Global Management plans to expand in Japan and add staff to its Asia wealth business, its regional top executive said, as global investment firms pump more resources into the region to capitalise on a surge in deals and assets.】

item.title: 9,500 万美元集体诉讼和解后，苹果澄清 Siri 隐私保护立场
item.description: 苹果公司周三澄清说，该公司从未出售其 Siri 语音助手收集的数据，也从未利用这些数据创建营销档案，而就在几天前，该公司刚刚与一起面临此类指控的案件达成和解。【原文：Apple clarified on Wednesday that it has never sold the data collected by its Siri voice assistant or used it to create marketing profiles, just days after settling a case in which it faced such accusations.】

item.title: 美元走强令英镑、欧元和日元持续承压
item.description: 受国债收益率上升的支撑，美元周四大幅走高，在关税威胁不断变化的背景下，日元、英镑和欧元在多个月低点附近承压。【原文：The U.S. dollar charged ahead on Thursday underpinned by rising Treasury yields, putting the yen, sterling and euro under pressure near multi-month lows amid the shifting threat of tariffs.】

item.title: 美国燃料库存增加，油价跌幅扩大
item.description: 受上周美国燃料库存大幅增加的打压，油价周四下跌，扩大了前一日的跌幅，但对欧佩克成员国和俄罗斯供应收紧的担忧抑制了油价的跌幅。【原文：Oil prices fell on Thursday, extending losses from the previous day, pressured by large builds in U.S. fuel inventories last week, though concerns over tighter supplies from OPEC members and Russia capped the decline.】
